creditline: Lent by Leo A. and Doris Hodroff
description:
coffee pot and cover; silver shape; pale green scalework and iron red scallop bands issuing gilt tassels; moths, beetles and other insects; rims with black and gilt floral bands; decoration after Cornelius Pronk
label has wrong acc. no. (L97.267.10)
text: This coffee pot's commanding conical shape, high domed lid, and angled handle and spout clearly relate to silver coffee and chocolate pots made in England.  Its decoration is an equally compelling example of western influence on Chinese Export porcelain.  The green scales and coloring resemble patterns attributed to Cornelius Pronk, while the delicate insects and flowers take their inspiration from illustrations by Maria Sybilla Merian.
title: Coffee pot
